data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The starting point is in the center of the circle and in the last step, you are taking 10 steps backward. Thus, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turning right means returning to your starting point. The original instruction has you moving right. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
A person walking to a starting point must make their way back to their starting place before they can turn around. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The first 5 steps are a direct return to the starting point, so 7 steps is actually going forwards and 1 step is backwards. The second step is a direct reversal of the first step. So, the answer is yes.

It would be difficult and time consuming to return to the starting point. Turn right -> Left -> Center. Turn around -> Right -> Center. So, the answer is No.

Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Take right. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Take right and then turn around. Take 7 steps and take 7 steps to return to the starting point. Thus, the answer is No.

Make sure to do the exact opposite, so that the starting point is not left. So, the answer is Yes.

If you turn around in six steps, you are back out of the starting point when you turn around again. It takes 8 steps to get back to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The starting point is facing in the direction you are going to. Left takes one step. The next step is the next one up, the second one to the right. We take 4 steps in the first step, 4 steps in the second step, 4 steps in the third step and 4 steps in the fourth. So, they are equal to 6 steps in the first step. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow the instructions, you take 3 steps. If you follow the instructions, you take 9 steps. If you turn around, you take 2 steps. If you take 7 steps, you return to the starting point. The answer: No.

If you are always facing forward you will always take 9 steps left and take 10 steps left. The first step should always be taken right when you are facing forward. The last step should always be taken left when you are facing right when you are facing forward. So, the answer is no.

The first step to the left is always upward and we are facing forward. The second step to the right is always left and the first step to the left is to the right. It is always to your right. When facing forward, one always starts in the direction you are facing right. When facing left, one always begins in the direction you are facing right. When facing left, one always begins in the direction you are facing up. When facing right, one never starts in the direction you are facing down. When facing forward, one always starts in the direction you are facing up. So, the answer is No.
